DOC.brief_summary: A cross-over study of the impact of histologic results of bronchial biopsies performed using hot clamps compared to bronchial biopsies using standard clamps
DOC.brief_title: Protocol for Anatomopathologic Analysis of Biopsies Using Hot Clamps
DOC.criteria: Patients 18 years of age or older Patients with no known hemorrhage risk, with an indication of endobronchial biopsy Patients with no contraindication for bronchial endoscopy Patients with or without endobronchial tumors Patients who have provided written informed consent Patients with health insurance coverage Refusal to be examined Contraindication for electrocoagulation (Pacemaker or metallic endobronchial prosthesis) Pregnant women Patients unable to provide voluntary informed consent, under (tutelage) or guardianship, or unable to come to the center
